meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>abbreviation</kanji>, so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to abbreviate</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to omit</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: The reading is, strangely, the same as the reading you learned with the kanji. <reading>りゃく</reading>す.
